reviewText: The movie is boring.  The plot isn't original.  It's about a girl who has a crush on a soccer player who doesn't return her feelings then bad things start to happen to his friends.  What made the movie a snoozer for us is there isn't any suspense.  The tormenting of the friends is very mild compared to other movies in the genre.  His friends open their curtains to find writing on their window stating "He's Mine".  Ohh then his girlfriend's nude pic gets sent to everyone in school.  And the most frightening is when his iPhone gets dropped in the swimming pool.The twist ending where the stalker isn't who you think she/he is didn't do much to redeem the movie.  I would recommend a rental as opposed to purchasing it outright.  If you want a "fatal attraction"/crush gone wrong movie I would recommend Fatal Attraction or Crush (staring Alicia Silverstone).  Fatal Attraction and Crush (with Alicia Silverstone) are older movies but they are well done and suspensefull.  Yes, a bit precictable but if it is well done then it will suck you in and you won't care.
summary: the "twist" ending did not help much
Title: Crush

reviewText: If you enjoyed this review, check out my horror film blog at: brandoncsites.blogspot.comCrush (2013) *1/2 / 4D: Malik BaderC: Lucas Till, Crystal Reed, Sarah Bolger, Meredith Salenger, Caitriona Balfe, Reid Ewing, Leigh Whannell, Holt McCallany, Camille GuatyP: A star athlete becomes the object of obsession for a secret admirer who's willing to do anything, including murder, to eliminate to the competition.Fatal Attraction light for the teenage demographic. Crush is one of those films that I can easily imagine a bunch of teenage girls watching while at a slumber party.Lucas Till is dreamy. Crystal Reed is angsty. There's a few false scares throughout, but nothing too terribly suspenseful. The dialogue, the interactions between the characters and the overall characterizations have been simplified for its target audience. Ohhhh .....and there's a twist.Surprisingly though, Crush is well made and well acted. A lot better made and acted then the genre requires of it. However, it's too mild mannered in its approach. It's unimaginative and an unnecessary addition to the genre. It's teen audience will, at the least, find Crush watchable, but that's because they really don't know any better. Horror & thriller aficionados will be bored as Crush is just another relentlessly lackluster example of the genre, the type of PG-13 type dreck that fans bemoan about online. [PG-13] 94 mins.
summary: Fatal Attraction light for the teen demographic
Title: Crush

reviewText: I am not in the teenage bracket so I gave an extra star for that.  I watched it with my daughter though and she was bored.  One of my all time favorite movies is Fatal Attraction WHICH IS WAY BETTER THAN THIS FILM!! This film copied greatly from that Kathy Bates movie Misery.  The problem more than anything else is that the film was boring.  If it were exciting it wouldn't even matter how silly it was concocted.  The girl you think at first will be the psycho but isn't reminded me of Jodi Arias, she was really good in her role but just couldn't save this film from going down.  Admittedly it was so dull and I watched it after been up too many hours so I kind of went in "half sleep orbit" after the "big twist I read about in other reviews" which was still dull but would never be inspired to watch this disaster again.  If you want to watch a really great thriller of this genre I suggest BASIC INSTINCT OR FATAL ATTRACTION.  I purchased this off other reviews that spoke to how great this was so I went in with an wide open mind but perhaps too high of expectations.  All this being said though I still think somebody sixteen or seventeen would like it; the guy everybody was hot for was great looking.
Title: Crush

reviewText: I enjoyed this movie. I know people bash on it a lot, but sometimes you have to accept movies for what they are. This movie was meant to me a teen thriller, an adolescent version of fatal attraction so to speak. Sure the film does not have the best acting, the plot has been done before, and the film is a bit predictable, but I did not expect this movie to be oscar worthy or change my life. I expected it to be a teeny-bopper thriller. And that's what I got. Not the best movie but not a waste of time.
Title: Crush

reviewText: Scott had it all until a sports injury crippled him during senior year. Now, he has to balance rehabilitation with friends, schoolwork, and a mysterious new crush, whose obsession with him threatens to destroy everything! From the very beginning, CRUSH plays into the same tired old cliches that frequent the thriller genre, first by introducing us to a group of well-groomed but utterly predictable teen stereotypes who make few attempts to gain our support. Lucas Till takes on the role of the pretty boy athlete against Crystal Reed's oddball loner, whose strange behavior leaves no room for ambiguity in the first and second acts. Right when it seems that everything has been figured out, however, writer Sonny Mallhi and director Malik Bader throw us for an unexpected loop that few will see coming. Some may say that the twist ending is a cheap cop out with insufficient clues, but at least it makes for a nice surprise. Although it is lacking in many regards, CRUSH travels at a brisk pace and offers a decent enough cast to carry the audience through to completion.-Carl ManesI Like Horror Movies
Title: Crush

Title: Crush

reviewText: CRUSH is slow-moving, virtually humorless, without a lot of serious tension or big turnabouts, and a bit hard to follow. A lot of people obviously like the twist at the end, but all I can say is that it didn't surprise me that much. Nevertheless, the ending IS a lot more effective and conclusive than many of them. CRUSH is also realistically filmed and acted and gives a convincing view of the darker aspects of adolescence, capturing its angst, jealousy, loneliness, and love hexagrams very well. The way the girls in the film all look sort of alike is initially confusing but really serves its purpose in the end. All things considered, CRUSH is like a fairly good Lifetime film on PCP.
Title: Crush

reviewText: I like it a lot had a very good twist didn't know that was coming very good ending be blessed!!!
Title: Crush

reviewText: Cross between Fatal Attraction and Misery (or Swim Fan and Misery) about a lonely teen outcast who has a painful crush on a hunky soccer player in her class.  She leaves him notes and follows him, watching from a distance and does other mildly creepy things.  But then bad things start happening to people close to the athlete.  Since they never show the perpetrator's face when any of the violent stuff happens it's pretty clear that there's going to be a twist--but it ends up working anyway.  After a genuinely chilling opening scene this is pretty slow until the last 30 minutes or so, but after it finally does pick up a little steam Crush turns into an entertaining thriller.
Title: Crush

reviewText: I wasn't sure what to think about this movie because some of the reviews weren't the best. Of course the story has been done before, but the twist at the end of this movie is what seperates it from the others. I was not expecting it at all. The acting was great too. I would recommend it to my friends and family.
Title: Crush

reviewText: What might have been yet another low-rent teenager-gone-berserk chiller turns out instead to have been created with considerable skill in the writing, acting, cinematography, and direction.  The story also has a topical "sexting" angle, as it includes an embarrassing photo sent around maliciously to everyone in the school - an issue that has been much in the news lately.  Both the story and the actor's characterizations show some real depth.  I was especially impressed by the work of Lucas Till (of whom the director said "the camera loves him") and Crystal Reed. Director Malik Bader makes the story flow fluidly and seamlessly, creating an atmosphere of foreboding and claustrophobia throughout.  Best of all, the film's cinematographer shot the movie with the Red One camera (I think it is the camera I spotted in the "Making of..." documentary), which makes for flawless, detailed, deep, and beautiful pictures.  It looks splendid on Blu-ray.  I shall be on the lookout for the next work from these talented folks.
Title: Crush

reviewText: I liked it okay, but I have seen better movies along the same line as this one. Wish it had a better plot.
Title: Crush

reviewText: This is a Great movie. Its just a good movie until that wonderful twist that made it great. Very much worth the watch. I had never heard of this movie and decided to give it a try, boy am I glad we did. The kids and I had a ball. Oh my kids are all in college and grad school. This is not a movie for younger kids. I watching with your kids I would say start at age 17.
Title: Crush

reviewText: CRUSH explores the oft-used theme of a predatory female terrorizing the popular high school jock.  Methodically paced and apparently predictable, CRUSH pulls a whopper of a 180 and pulls the biggest I GOTCHA in modern horror cinema.The moment before this deception occurred, I told my wife "I wonder..." and kaboom, I was right.  That twist did demonstrate the writer's cleverness in working his audience and makes CRUSH a tidy little thriller.  Lucas Till brings a sense of honor to a usually cliché role; Crystal Reed has a disturbing edginess as mousy Bess and Sarah Bol;ger displays both sexiness and naivete in her role of Till's true love.CRUSH manipulates the viewer quite shamelessly and sets a new standard for cinema stalkers.
Title: Crush

reviewText: I really loved a great deal about this movie and I still think it's very worthwhile.  However, there is a flaw that prevented it from becoming a small cult classic.  They try way too hard to keep the audience off balance.  I never thought I would call that a flaw.  This is a very rare instance where they should have kept the plot slightly more derivative and stuck with the formula.  I won't give spoilers.  I just kept thinking through the first half of the movie how much better it seemed than impressions I formed from reviews.  A certain moment arrives in the movie and it simply changes the atmosphere, not because it was implausible, but because it simply tried too hard.  It's like when I made this girl I liked in college two cheesecakes for her birthday.  I was completely genuine, the cheesecakes were awesome, but sometimes it's just too much and you can guess the effect.THE GOOD: With that out of the way, I want to say how much this movie really had going for it.  Crystal Reed is very, very good as the creepy quiet girl with the crush.  Yet, in the fantasy scene where she imagines herself with confidence, the transformation is astounding and she is so gorgeous and nice it's heartbreaking.  It's just a fleeting glimpse for the audience to see what could be, but isn't.  Lucas Till as the object of her desire is also terrific.  The temptation to turn him into such an adonis that the audience secretly hates him is thankfully avoided.  He is appropriately handsome enough to attract a fanatic admirer, athletic and sympathetic.  I have loved Sarah Bolger ever since I saw her in Tudors and she definitely isn't a disappointment in this movie.  All the performances were spot on and deserve all the praise that can be given.  Crystal Reed as the primary is really the one that sells it though.  The characters and plot are really well fleshed out and would have carried the movie well without one or two extra twists.  I really thought the music soundtrack to this movie was great too.  All in all a terrific movie regardless with much to recommend it.THE PLOT:  It starts simple enough that I don't have to give a lot of details.  A high school soccer star attracts a ardent admirer (some would say stocker).  At conflict is the soccer star's popular and beautiful female friend who is trying hard to be more to him than just a friend. The popular girl becomes an obvious rival and obstruction to the admirer from afar.  A hot high school teacher also has a thing for the young soccer star and the audience is not entirely sure if he will ignore her inappropriate attention or not.  Things get out of hand when someone mysteriously begins to dismantle the lives of all the women with any connection to him.Go into this movie with a realization that it won't be perfect and you may like it a lot.  You might want to rent it first.
summary: MUCH TO LIKE....WITH A FLAW  (or too much of a good thing)
Title: Crush

reviewText: You know it's coming - but when homicide hits in this movie, it comes with the speed of a rattlesnake strike. It's swifter than the eye can capture, and it's more sinister than any thuggish attack could ever be.After a shocker of an opening sequence, the movie proceeds at a slower pace for a while. We see the very socially awkward and involute Bess yearning after the handsome jock in her school. The tension builds as we wonder how far her obsession has taken her in the past and is taking her in the present. Almost everyone is suspect though.This is a good effort at a psychological thriller. The protagonists really talk with each other - or at least exchange more telling texts. So we get to know them better than we do in the average thriller that's being cranked out. Their motivations aren't always very clear or consistent, and the writers perhaps did some reaching for a different, interesting resolution. But I think you'll find this movie worth your time.One warning: Don't look too closely at the jacket of the DVD, so no part of the ending will be revealed to you.
summary: Where Death Strikes with Shocking Suddenness
Title: Crush

reviewText: Well-done horror flick with characters who have brains, some that are somewhat askew. Pleasant twists and surprises that keep the interest going. This review is after my first viewing. I'd watch again with friends. Not for kids.
Title: Crush

reviewText: I picked up the movie because I haven't seen a good psycho killer movie in a while. I wasn't expecting much from it but was actually intrigued during the entire film. If this movie would have been released to the theaters, I think it would have done very well just by word of mouth. It was presented very well for a low budget movie an also had solid acting. I have seen films featuring Lucas Till and have been impressed with the way he delivers his characters. I think he is someone who is going to have very good career with movies. I don't want to give anything away from the film, so I will leave my review at this.
Title: Crush

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: The film centers around Bess (Crystal Reed) and her crush on Scott (Lucas Till). Bess is the socially awkward new kid. She seemingly lives alone in a house while working at a book store. Scott has looks, brains, and athletic ability. All the girls drool over him. Jules (Sarah Bolger) is his girlfriend who he breaks up with because he needs to concentrate. (Seriously, can you believe a guy wrote this?)Other people include teammate Casey (Preston Davis) who believes Scott is a ball hog. Scott's dad is protective and is always going out to work. And Jeffrey (Reid Ewing) has a crush on Bess. Their relationship is encouraged by an older woman and confidant (Meredith Salenger) who works at the bookshop.Accidents happen to people around Scott. We get to see the arm or hand of the person who is revealed to us about an hour into the film when our fairly decent mystery turns into "Misery."I couldn't help think that the song "Love Stinks" would have made a good title track had they made this film 30 years ago...before the target audience existed. The film covers the many aspect of teen angst as we see it cross the line from "cute to creepy." As part of the older crowd, I had to laugh when two teens standing on opposites sides of a glass door opt to have a conversation by texting. Open your mouths!At one point Scott finds a note in his locker. The movie didn't give me tie to read it. I had to pause the film.I like quirky crush films where we know who the killer is and see the odd if not comical things she does. This isn't that film and it would have worked better my way. This is a film for those girls whose first crush still weighs heavy.Parental Guide: 1 F-bomb. No nudity. Making out on bed.
Title: Crush
